intro: Ouratea rinconensis, commonly known as the Rincón ouratea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale pink. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in the understory of tropical forests. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, winged seeds.
